actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Education and the Workforce
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Early Childhood, Youth and Families.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Early Childhood, Youth and Families

official_title: Expressing the sense of Congress that State and local governments and local educational agencies are encouraged to dedicate a day of learning to the study and understanding of the Declaration of Independence, the United States Constitution, and the Federalist Papers.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of Congress that State and local governments and local educational agencies are encouraged to: (1) dedicate at least one day of learning to the study and understanding of the significance of the Declaration of Independence, the Constitution, and the Federalist Papers; and (2) include a requirement that, before receiving a certificate or diploma of graduation from high school, students be tested on their competency in understanding those works.

titles.title: Expressing the sense of Congress that State and local governments and local educational agencies are encouraged to dedicate a day of learning to the study and understanding of the Declaration of Independence, the United States Constitution, and the Federalist Papers.
